conclusion: Determine which container (E or F) the liquid will flow into after passing through the baffles.
The liquid from A is orange.
The liquid from A falls straight down and hits the first baffle.
The first baffle redirects the flow from A towards the left side.
The liquid from A drips off the edge of the baffle and flows down towards the bottom left corner.
The liquid from A ends up in container E.
The liquid from B is light blue.
The liquid from B falls straight down and hits the second baffle.
The second baffle redirects the flow from B towards the right side.
The liquid from B drips off the edge of the baffle and flows down towards the bottom right corner.
The liquid from B ends up in container F.
The liquid from C is yellow.
The liquid from C falls straight down and hits the third baffle.
The third baffle redirects the flow from C towards the right side.
The liquid from C drips off the edge of the baffle and flows down towards the bottom right corner.
The liquid from C ends up in container F.
The liquid from D is dark blue.
The liquid from D falls straight down and hits the fourth baffle.
The fourth baffle redirects the flow from D towards the right side.
The liquid from D drips off the edge of the baffle and flows down towards the bottom right corner.
The liquid from D ends up in container F.
Final answer: The liquid from A will flow into container E, while the liquids from B, C, and D will flow into container F.
